FILE: cm200365v11.0.txt
DYAD: UNITED KINGDOM-RUSSIA/USSR
RIVALRY: RIV436
DISPUTE(S): MID153 MID216
RIVALRY: RIV437
DISPUTE(S): MID236 MID57 MID227
RIVALRY: RIV438
DISPUTE(S): MID3323 MID307 MID3324 MID119 MID242 MID197 MID2606 MID2366 MID2363 MID2605 MID2365 MID2604 MID2364 MID1133 MID186 MID241 
RIVALRY: RIV439
DISPUTE(S): MID258 MID3860 MID603 MID26 MID3196 MID3195 MID3201 MID208 MID200 MID125 MID608 MID27 MID1353 MID2915 MID2933 MID2226 MID4334 MID4342

RIVNOTES: 
RIV439: MID2232 removed in because does not appear in the COW dyadic 3.1 data or the Maoz 2.0 dyadic data. 

RIV438: MID16 removed in because does not appear in the COW dyadic 3.1 data or the Maoz 2.0 dyadic data. 

RIV439: MID3241 (1970) was removed in mid3.02 it was a 1970 incident involving major powers and Iraq and Syria. MID4342 (1999) was added by MID3.02

PS: 19009999-19070830 0.00 19070831-19170103 .5 19170104-19230701 0.00 19230702-19410711 0.25 19410712-19460801 0.5 19460802-19891108 0.00 19891109-19921110 -9 19921111-20209999 .25

PS-UPDATE2020: Under the rivalry termination rule the relationship would normally end 5 years after the end of the rivalry on 19410712 but this would leave a 2 week relationship gap before the start of a new rivalry in 1946 - accordingly we extend the relationship for two weeks and thereby make the relationship continuous.

PSNOTES: thompson rivalry cm200365 ,18160000 ,19560000 
The .75 period should end on July 11, 1941 and the .5 period begin the day after - the latter is the date of the Anglo-Soviet alliance

PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220218
PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220218

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

Pre-1900 MIDs: MID153 MID216 MID236 MID57 MID227 MID3323 MID307 MID3324 MID119 MID16

WWI MIDs: MID197 MID2606 MID2366 MID2363 

WWII MIDs: MID258 MID3860 

MID242 

TERRMID: MID242 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID242 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID242 from Gibler (2018), this was connected to the Russo-Japanese War. Russian ships mistook UK fishing vessels as Japanese torpedo boats. The UK protested, and a crisis developed but stopped short of war. Coded third party link to territory because this occurred during and was connected to the Russo-Japanese War, a territorial dispute between Russia and Japan. 

MARITMID: MID242 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID242 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID242 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID242 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID242 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID242 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID242 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID2605 

TERRMID: MID2605 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2605 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2605 from Gibler (2018), this is Estonia's war for independence from Russia in 1918. Estonia had declared independence from its colonizer, Russia, during Russia's civil war. After Russia exited WWI, it re-focused on its civil war, including attempting to regain control over Estonia. UK assisted Estonia in its war against Russia and eventually they drove the Soviets out of Estonia. Coded third party link to territorial MID because Russia claimed all of Estonia's territory, making this a territorial MID between Russia and Estonia. 

MARITMID: MID2605 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2605 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2605 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2605 from Gibler (2018), this was connected to events of the Russian Civil War, which involved Estonia's fight for independence. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to the Russian civil war. See CIVWARLINK.

CIVWARLINK: MID2605 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2605 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2605 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2605 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID2365 

TERRMID: MID2365 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2365 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2365 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2365 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2365 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2365 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2365 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2365 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2365 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2365 3 -- uncertain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2365 from Gibler, Little, and Miller 2016, this is the Allied Powers' involvement in the Russian Civil War. The UK intervened in northern Russia to fight the Bolsheviks. Coded uncertain because GLM recommend this case be dropped because it is essentially a duplicate of MID197, except with a later start date so as not to overlap with WWI. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2365 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2365 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2365 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2365 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2365 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2365 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID2604 

TERRMID: MID2604 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2604 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2604 from Gibler (2018), Latvia had declared independence from Russia during Russia's civil war. Here, Russia invaded Latvia, claiming all of Latvia as its own. The UK, Poland, and Germany intervened to help push the Russians out. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was a territorial dispute between Russia and Latvia, and the UK intervened to help Latvia. 

MARITMID: MID2604 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2604 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2604 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2604 coded civil war MID because this occurred during the Russian civil war, as the Bolsheviks were fighting to control all of Russia, including Latvia, which the Bolsheviks considered to be part of Russia's territory. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2604 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID2604 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID2604 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID2604 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID2364 

TERRMID: MID2364 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2364 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID2364 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID2364 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID2364 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID2364 from Gibler (2018), this occurred during the Russian Civil War. In 1920, The UK was supporting the White Army against the Red Army. UK ships in the Black Sea were protecting White Army forces when they attacked the Red Army on the Crimean Peninsula. Coded civil war MID because this was connected to the events of the Russian Civil War. 

CIVWARLINK: MID2364 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES:

COUPLINK-CER: MID2364 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID1133 

TERRMID: MID1133 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID1133 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1133 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1133 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID1133 from Gibler (2018), Russia invaded northern Persia with the intention of expelling the UK troops stationed there. Coded not third party link to territory because Russia was not claiming any Persian territory, but was trying to weaken the British presence in the area.

MID186 

TERRMID: MID186 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID186 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID186 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID186 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID186 from Gibler (2018), this is the UK response to the Soviet invasion of Poland in 1920. The Soviets were occupying Poland and claiming it as their territory. The UK threatened to intervene but ultimately did nothing. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was connected to the territorial dispute between Russia and Poland. 

MARITMID: MID186 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID186 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID186 3 -- not islands

MID241 

TERRMID: MID241 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID241 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID241 1 -- maritime
MARITMID-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID241 from Gibler (2018), Russia expanded its territorial water sovereignty from 3 to 12 miles off its shore, and UK rejected this claim. The UK sent naval vessels to protect the fishing vessels in waters claimed by the Soviets. Russia seized a UK trawler in 1923, and the UK issued an ultimatum for the Russians to release the ship. Coded maritime because this was a dispute over Russia's maritime EEZ boundary. 

ISLMID: MID241 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID241 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID241 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID241 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID241 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID241 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID603 

TERRMID: MID603 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID603 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID603 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID603 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID603 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID603 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID603 from Gibler (2018), this is connected to domestic protests in Iran. In 1946, UK moved troops to the Iran-Iraq border, worrying that domestic turmoil in Iran could harm UK business interests. Russia, protecting their interests from within Iran, moved troops to the border as well. Coded not civil war link because although domestic protests in Iran (outside of this dyad) led to this MID, there is no indication of militarized rebel activity in Iran. 

COUPMID: MID603 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID603 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID603 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID26 

TERRMID: MID26 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID26 from cm002365 narrative, this MID is the Berlin blockade crisis. Russia blockaded West Berlin after the US' plans for economic recovery and independence for a West German state became known. The US/UK/France responded to the blockade by airlifting supplies into West Berlin. The US/UK/France and Russia had repeated exchanges of shows of force. Coded not territorial because the UK and Russia were not disputing territory between them. 

TERRLINK: MID26 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID26 coded not third party link to territory. Although this MID was about the territory that would become West Germany (Federal Republic of Germany) -- and West and East Germany would later have a territorial dispute -- neither East nor West Germany was yet a state, so no territorial claim was present , and the UK and Russia were therefore not linked to a territorial dispute in this MID. 

MARITMID: MID26 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID26 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID26 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID26 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID26 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID26 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID26 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID3196 

TERRMID: MID3196 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3196 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3196 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3196 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3196 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3196 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3196 from Gibler (2018), Russia seized a UK trawler. After a fine was paid, the Soviets released the vessel. Coded not maritime because this was a fishing dispute and they were not disputing the maritime boundary. 

ISLMID: MID3196 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3196 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3196 3 -- not civil war

COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID3195 

TERRMID: MID3195 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3195 from Gibler (2018), this is connected to the Iranian threat to nationalize the Anglo-Iranian Oil Company, owned by UK. Iran asked Russia to intervene if UK sent in troops to protect its interests, and Russia massed troops along the border. UK sent a cruiser but ultimately did not intervene. Coded not territory because UK and Iran were not disputing territory, and this was about UK's oil interests. No indication that a piece of territory was being claimed by UK as part of this dispute. 

TERRLINK: MID3195 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3195 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3195 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3195 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3195 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3195 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3195 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3195 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID3201 

TERRMID: MID3201 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3201 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3201 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3201 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3201 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3201 3 -- uncertain 
MARITMID-NOTES: MID3201 from Gibler, Little, and Miller 2016, this is the seizure of several UK fishing boats by Russia. Coded not maritime because they were not disputing a maritime boundary. Coded uncertain because GL argue this case should be dropped, as UK did not protest the seizures. 

ISLMID: MID3201 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3201 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3201 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3201 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3201 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3201 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID3201 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3201 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3201 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID208 

TERRMID: MID208 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID208 from cm002365 narrative, occurred in March of 1953 and is a multilateral dispute with the US and the UK versus the USSR and Czechoslovakia. Czechoslovakia sentenced a US reporter to prison for espionage. The US imposed economic sanctions, and Czechoslovakia shot down a US military aircraft over US-occupied Germany. Coded not territorial because the UK and Czechoslovakia did not have a territorial dispute. See TERRLINK.

TERRLINK: MID208 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID208 from cm002365 narrative, this is a multilateral dispute with the US and the UK versus the USSR and Czechoslovakia. Coded not third party link because this was not connected to a territorial dispute but was rather connected to general Cold War tensions. Territorial disputes, namely the East Germany-West Germany dispute, was involved in the Cold War, but that did not connect to this incident. 

MARITMID: MID208 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID208 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID208 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID208 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID208 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID208 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID208 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID200 

TERRMID: MID200 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID200 from cm002365 narrative, MID200 is the Sinai War between Israel and Egypt and a multilateral MID. Israel and Egypt were rivals and tensions between them had been escalating, including cross-border raids, opposing arms deals, and troop movements around the Sinai. The UK is involved in this MID due to its support for Israel. Russia is invovled in this MID due to its support of Egypt/opposition of Israel, and its support for Czechoslovakia, who made a large arms deal with Israel shortly before the invasion. In 1956, Israel invaded the Sinai Peninsula with the intention of reclaiming it for itself and its Western allies, namely France and Britain. Coded not territory because the UK and USSR did not dispute territory here. See TERRLINK: Israel invaded Sinai with the intention of annexing the territory, although it abandoned this claim when its Western allies demanded it do so. 

TERRLINK: MID200 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID200 from cm002365 narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving allies of Israel and Egypt. Coded territorial link because Israel and Egypt were involved in a territorial MID here, and the UK and Russia were pulled in to the dispute due to their support of opposing sides of the dispute. 

MARITMID: MID200 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID200 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID200 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARLINK: MID200 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID200 from cm002365 narrative, part of the building tensions between Egypt and Israel came from Egypt sponsoring a rebel group, Fedayeen, to conduct attacks on Israel. In response, Israel conducted cross-border raids in Egypt, which were some of the events that this MID comprises. Coded civil war link because Egypt sponsored a militarized rebel group against Israel, outside of this dyad, which led to events that contributed to this MID. 

COUPMID: MID200 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID200 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID200 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID125 

TERRMID: MID125 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID125 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID125 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID125 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID125 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID125 from cm002365 narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving the US and UK against USSR, Iraq, and Egypt. In 1958, a faction of military officers overthrew the Iraqi monarchy in a coup, and this stoked revolutionary sentiment in Lebanon, where a civil war was already ongoing. The US and UK landed troops in Lebanon at Lebanon's request to keep the regime in place. USSR, Iraq, and Egypt provided assistance to the revolutionaries in Lebanon, triggering this MID. Coded not civil war MID because the civil war in Lebanon is outside of this dyad. See CIVWARLINK.

CIVWARLINK: MID125 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID125 coded civil war link because the Lebanese civil war triggered a multilateral MID, including this MID between UK and Russia. Since the Lebanese civil war is outside of this dyad, it is a civil war link MID. 

COUPMID: MID125 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID125 1 -- coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID125 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: MID125 the coup in Iraq contributed to the civil war in Lebanon, and the new Iraqi regime supported the revolutionaries in Lebanon, contributing to this MID. Iraq is outside this dyad. 


MID608 

TERRMID: MID608 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID608 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID608 from cm narrative, this is a multilateral MID involving the US, UK, and France against USSR. Soviet Premier Khrushchev issued an ultimatum for the Western powers to vacate Berlin and withdraw all military resources from there, making West Berlin a sovereign city. Khrushchev also said Russia would turn all lines of communication with West Berlin to East Germany, so the West would only have access to West Berlin through East Germany's permission. The Western powers responded by firmly asserting their determination to remain in West Berlin. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was centered on the West Germany-East Germany territorial dispute, and UK and USSR are pulled into this MID against each other due to their opposing diplomatic and military support. 

MARITMID: MID608 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID608 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID608 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID608 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID608 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID608 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID608 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID27 

TERRMID: MID27 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID27 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID27 is a multilateral MID involving Czechoslovakia, Poland, East Germany, and the USSR versus the USA, the UK, France, and West Germany. This is the crisis that eventually led to the construction of the Berlin Wall in August 1961. Khrushchev gave an ultimatum for the US to leave West Berlin, which threatened the status of West Berlin. The USSR was concerned about the growing military power of West Germany and threatened to sign a peace treaty with East Germany, further threatening western interests. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this was centered on the East Germany-West Germany territorial dispute, and the UK and USSR are pulled into this dispute against each other due to their opposing support. 

MARITMID: MID27 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID27 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES:

CIVWARMID-CER: MID27 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-CER: MID27 1 -- certain

MID1353 

TERRMID: MID1353 3 -- not territory

TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1353 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1353 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1353 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1353 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1353 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1353 from cm002365 narrative, this is related to the Laotian Civil War that takes place from 1963 to 1973. China directly supported the Pathet Lao communist insurgency and conducted military operations in northern Laos, and the USSR provided less direct support to communist insurgents. The UK supported the Royal Laotian Government (RLG) forces. USSR forces directly engaged in combat with RLG forces and provided them with weapons and training, triggering this MID due to the UK support for RLG forces and USSR's support for communist forces. Coded civil war link because the civil war in Laos is outside of this dyad and led to this MID. 

COUPMID: MID1353 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID1353 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID1353 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


MID2915 

TERRMID: MID2915 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID2915 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID2915 3 -- not third party link to territory
TERRLINK-CER: MID2915 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID2915 from Gibler (2018), Soviet planes violated West German airspace, which UK was patrolling and enforcing. Coded not third party link to territory because although this incident did involve a violation of West German airspace, and the East Germany-West Germany territorial dispute was currently active, there is no indication that this was directly tied to that territorial dispute rather than the general Cold War tensions between the USSR and the US and its allies.

MARITMID: MID2933 3 -- not maritime

MARITMID-NOTES: MID2933 from Gibler (2018), UK seized a Soviet trawler near UK waters. Coded not maritime because the countries were not disputing a maritime boundary.

MARITMID-NOTES: MID2226 from cm002365 narrative, this involves a show of ships, or a mutual display of naval power, between USSR and several NATO countries, including the UK. Coded not maritime because the UK and USSR were not disputing a maritime boundary here, and this seems to be a product of general Cold War tensions.

MID4334 

TERRMID: MID4334 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4334 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4334 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID4334 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4334 from cm narrative, as KFOR was preparing to move into Kosovo, Russian troops quickly moved out into Kosovo in an attempt to reach Pristina. In response to the Russian movements, the UK placed its troops on alert (which lasted 4.5 hours) to move into Pristina before the Russian troops arrived and stop the Russians "by any means necessary." Through diplomatic discourse UK yielded and allowed Russian troops to enter Pristina uncontested. Coded third party link to territorial MID because the UK and Russia are on opposing sides in this MID due to their ooposing support in the Kosovo War, a territorial dispute between Kosovo and Yugoslavia. 

MARITMID: MID4334 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4334 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4334 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4334 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4334 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4334 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID4334 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4334 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4334 coded civil war link because the Kosovo War featured militarized rebel groups organized along ethnic lines, including ethnic Albanians fighting against the Yugoslavian Army. Kosovo is outside this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID4334 3 -- not coup

MID4342 

TERRMID: MID4342 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4342 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4342 1 -- third party link to territorial
TERRLINK-CER: MID4342 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID4342 from Gibler (2018), this is connected to a NATO bombing in Yugoslavia. Russia put its forces on high alert and warned NATO against provoking a broader war. Coded third party link to territorial MID because UK, as part of NATO, and Russia were supporting opposite sides of the Yugoslavian Wars, a series of territorial disputes. 

MARITMID: MID4342 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4342 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4342 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4342 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4342 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4342 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID4342 from Gibler (2018), this involves UK (as part of NATO) war activity in Yugoslavia, who Russia was supporting. Coded civil war link because the Yugoslav Wars featured extensive violence by militarized rebel groups organized along ethnic lines, and Yugoslavia is outside this dyad.

MID1039

TERRMID: MID1039 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID1039 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID1039 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID1039 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID1039 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID1039 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID1039 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID1039 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID1039 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID1039 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID1039 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID1039 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID1039 from Gibler 2018, a Palestinian terrorist group hijacked a plane of mostly American passengers that was headed to Jordan. The intent was to provoke fighting between between Jordan and Palestinian rebels. Jordan indeed attacked Palestinian rebels, and the US was publicly concerned with Syrian or Iraqi involvement to assist the PLO. The USSR assured the US that no outside intervention would occur, but Syrian forces invaded Jordan anyway. The crisis de-escalated. Coded civil war link because militarized rebel activity against Jordan (outside this dyad; the rebels also resided outside this dyad) led to this MID between Jordan, Israel, UK, and US versus Iraq and Syria. Coded uncertain because Gibler 2018 does not consider USSR a party to this MID, as they only are involved by providing assurances to US that tensions would not flare.

COUPLINK-CER: MID1039 1 -- certain
